com.arm.mbed.cloud.sdk.devices.model

Class Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arm.mbed.cloud.sdk.devices.model.Device
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SdkModel, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    @Preamble(description="Model for a device.")
public class Device
extends java.lang.Object
implements SdkModel
    Model for a device.

      • Device

        public Device(java.lang.String accountId,
              boolean autoUpdate,
              java.util.Date bootstrapExpirationDate,
              java.util.Date bootstrappedTimestamp,
              java.lang.String caId,
              java.util.Date connectorExpirationDate,
              java.util.Date createdAt,
              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customAttributes,
              DeviceDeployedState deployedState,
              java.lang.String deployment,
              java.lang.String description,
              java.lang.String deviceClass,
              int deviceExecutionMode,
              java.lang.String deviceKey,
              java.lang.String endpointName,
              java.lang.String endpointType,
              java.util.Date enrolmentListTimestamp,
              java.lang.String firmwareChecksum,
              java.lang.String hostGateway,
              java.lang.String id,
              java.lang.String issuerFingerprint,
              java.lang.String manifest,
              java.util.Date manifestTimestamp,
              DeviceMechanism mechanism,
              java.lang.String mechanismUrl,
              java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String serialNumber,
              DeviceState state,
              java.util.Date updatedAt,
              java.lang.String vendorId)
        Internal constructor.

        Constructor based on all fields.

        Note: Should not be used. Use Device() instead.

        Parameters:
        accountId - The ID of the associated account.
        autoUpdate - DEPRECATED: Mark this device for automatic firmware update.
        bootstrapExpirationDate - The expiration date of the certificate used to connect to bootstrap server.
        bootstrappedTimestamp - The timestamp of the device's most recent bootstrap process.
        caId - The certificate issuer's ID.
        connectorExpirationDate - The expiration date of the certificate used to connect to LwM2M server.
        createdAt - The timestamp of when the device was created in the device directory.
        customAttributes - Up to five custom key-value attributes. Note that keys cannot begin with a number. Both keys and values are limited to 128 characters. Updating this field replaces existing contents.
        deployedState - DEPRECATED: The state of the device's deployment.
        deployment - DEPRECATED: The last deployment used on the device.
        description - The description of the device.
        deviceClass - An ID representing the model and hardware revision of the device.
        deviceExecutionMode - The execution mode from the certificate of the device. Defaults to inheriting from host_gateway device. Permitted values: - 0 - unspecified execution mode (default if host_gateway invalid or not set) - 1 - development devices - 5 - production devices.
        deviceKey - The fingerprint of the device certificate.
        endpointName - The endpoint name given to the device.
        endpointType - The endpoint type of the device. For example, the device is a gateway.
        enrolmentListTimestamp - The claim date/time.
        firmwareChecksum - The SHA256 checksum of the current firmware image.
        hostGateway - The ID of the host gateway, if appropriate.
        id - The ID of the device. The device ID is used across all Device Management APIs.
        issuerFingerprint - SHA256 fingerprint of the certificate used to validate the signature of the device certificate.
        manifest - DEPRECATED: The URL for the current device manifest.
        manifestTimestamp - The timestamp of the current manifest version.
        mechanism - The ID of the channel used to communicate with the device.
        mechanismUrl - The address of the connector to use.
        name - The name of the device.
        serialNumber - The serial number of the device.
        state - The current state of the device.
        updatedAt - The time the object was updated.
        vendorId - The device vendor ID.

        Internal constructor.

        Constructor based on read-only fields.

        Note: Should not be used. Use Device() instead.

        Parameters:
        accountId - The ID of the associated account.
        bootstrappedTimestamp - The timestamp of the device's most recent bootstrap process.
        createdAt - The timestamp of when the device was created in the device directory.
        deployedState - DEPRECATED: The state of the device's deployment.
        endpointName - The endpoint name given to the device.
        enrolmentListTimestamp - The claim date/time.
        firmwareChecksum - The SHA256 checksum of the current firmware image.
        manifestTimestamp - The timestamp of the current manifest version.
        updatedAt - The time the object was updated.

        public int getDeviceExecutionMode()
        Gets the execution mode from the certificate of the device. defaults to inheriting from host_gateway device. permitted values: - 0 - unspecified execution mode (default if host_gateway invalid or not set) - 1 - development devices - 5 - production devices.
        Returns:
        deviceExecutionMode

      • setDeviceExecutionMode

        public void setDeviceExecutionMode(int deviceExecutionMode)
        Sets the execution mode from the certificate of the device. defaults to inheriting from host_gateway device. permitted values: - 0 - unspecified execution mode (default if host_gateway invalid or not set) - 1 - development devices - 5 - production devices.
        Parameters:
        deviceExecutionMode - The execution mode from the certificate of the device. Defaults to inheriting from host_gateway device. Permitted values: - 0 - unspecified execution mode (default if host_gateway invalid or not set) - 1 - development devices - 5 - production devices.

        See Also:
        Object.hashCode()

      • canEqual

        protected boolean canEqual(java.lang.Object other)
        Method to ensure equals(Object) is correct.

        Note: see this article: canEqual()

        Parameters:
        other - another object.
        Returns:
        true if the other object is an instance of the class in which canEqual is (re)defined, false otherwise.
